data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهِ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: (lana)To soften, make tender, lenient, gentle, smooth.linatun - apalm-tree of which the dates are of very inferior quality and are unfit for human consumption.
data.sentence: The word لَنْ comes from the root ل ن and is associated with the meanings: (lana)To soften, make tender, lenient, gentle, smooth.linatun - apalm-tree of which the dates are of very inferior quality and are unfit for human consumption.

data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
data.sentence: The word قُلْ comes from the root ق و ل and is associated with the meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.

data.meanings: he wrote it, to dictate it, prescribe/appoint/ordain, judged / passed sentence / decreed, drew/brought together, collected, conjoined / bound, he sewed it, what is written (e.g. of law), mode/manner of writing, book, bookseller, a thing in which or on which one writes, record/register/writ, revealed scripture, a writer/scribe/secretary, an army/military force, troop.

data.meanings: to be close, near, follow, be up to.tawalla (prf. 3rd. m. sing.) - turneth away.tawallau (prf. 3rd. m. pl.) - they turned away.tawallaitum (prf. 2nd. m. pl.) - ye turned away.yatawalla (impf. 3rd. m. pl.) - he turns away.
data.sentence: The word مَوْلَانَا comes from the root و ل ي and is associated with the meanings: to be close, near, follow, be up to.tawalla (prf. 3rd. m. sing.) - turneth away.tawallau (prf. 3rd. m. pl.) - they turned away.tawallaitum (prf. 2nd. m. pl.) - ye turned away.yatawalla (impf. 3rd. m. pl.) - he turns away.

data.meanings: to entrust, confirm, give, charge, dispose affairs, lean upon, reply upon.
data.sentence: The word فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ comes from the root و ك ل and is associated with the meanings: to entrust, confirm, give, charge, dispose affairs, lean upon, reply upon.

data.meanings: to pour forth, hit the mark, come down. asaaba - to overtake, happen to, befall, fall upon, will, affect injuriously, meet with, send down, pour down upon, afflict or punish, intend, desire. sawaabun - that which is right, straight forward course, rightness. musiibun - that which happens. musiibatun - calamity. Lane: "...it poured forth (said of rain), it descended, a calamity that falls upon or becomes settled/fixed..."
data.sentence: The word يُصِيبَنَا comes from the root ص و ب and is associated with the meanings: to pour forth, hit the mark, come down. asaaba - to overtake, happen to, befall, fall upon, will, affect injuriously, meet with, send down, pour down upon, afflict or punish, intend, desire. sawaabun - that which is right, straight forward course, rightness. musiibun - that which happens. musiibatun - calamity. Lane: "...it poured forth (said of rain), it descended, a calamity that falls upon or becomes settled/fixed..."
